title: Scale Input Values with Constants
description:
DEG_TO_DIR calculates a direction (0 .360 degrees) into to compass rea￾dings. At the input DEG the direction in degrees is available (0 = North, 90
= East, 180 = South and 270 = West ). The output represents the directi￾on as String NNE. With the input N the maximum length of the direction in￾dication is limited. When N = 1, only in the 4 cardinal directions N, E, S, W
dissolved. If N = 2 between each another direction is inserted: NE, SE, SW,
NW. At N = 3 are also directions as NNO ... are dissolved, with N = 3 a to￾tal of 16 directions are evaluated. The input L allows the switching of the
languages defned in the language setup. 0L = 0 means Default Langua￾ge, a number > 0 is one of the predefned languages. more info about the
pre-defned data types can be found at CONSTANTS_LANGUAGE.
name: SCALE_X8

input.name: in1
input.description: The first boolean input that determines whether the first minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in2
input.description: The second boolean input that determines whether the second minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in3
input.description: The third boolean input that determines whether the third minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in4
input.description: The fourth boolean input that determines whether the fourth minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in5
input.description: The fifth boolean input that determines whether the fifth minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in6
input.description: The sixth boolean input that determines whether the sixth minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in7
input.description: The seventh boolean input that determines whether the seventh minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: in8
input.description: The eighth boolean input that determines whether the eighth minimum or maximum value is considered.

input.name: K
input.description: The scaling factor to be applied to the sum of the selected minimum and maximum values.

input.name: O
input.description: The offset to be added to the scaled sum.

input.name: in1_min
input.description: Minimum value for the first input.

input.name: in1_max
input.description: Maximum value for the first input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in2_min
input.description: Minimum value for the second input.

input.name: in2_max
input.description: Maximum value for the second input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in3_min
input.description: Minimum value for the third input.

input.name: in3_max
input.description: Maximum value for the third input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in4_min
input.description: Minimum value for the fourth input.

input.name: in4_max
input.description: Maximum value for the fourth input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in5_min
input.description: Minimum value for the fifth input.

input.name: in5_max
input.description: Maximum value for the fifth input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in6_min
input.description: Minimum value for the sixth input.

input.name: in6_max
input.description: Maximum value for the sixth input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in7_min
input.description: Minimum value for the seventh input.

input.name: in7_max
input.description: Maximum value for the seventh input, default is 1000.0.

input.name: in8_min
input.description: Minimum value for the eighth input.

input.name: in8_max
input.description: Maximum value for the eighth input, default is 1000.0.

output.name: SCALE_X8
output.description: The calculated scaled and offset sum of the selected input values.

return_value.description: The result of the scaling operation based on the input parameters.
